#Text=Create an Upcycled Planter and a Wooden Pallet Planter
#Text=A great start to a healthier life is to grow your own fruits and vegetables .
#Text=You do n’t need a big space to have a garden , as you can grow your own produce with small planters .

#Text=In this article , you will learn how to make an upcycled planter where you can start to grow your plant and a Wooden Pallet Planter where you can then transfer your plant into later so it can start to grow crops .
#Text=Things You ’ll Need
#Text=1 Empty 2L plastic bottle with cap
#Text=10-12 inches of cotton wick
#Text=10-20 liters of potting soil
#Text=Clean pallet
#Text=Sandpaper
#Text=Nails
#Text=Hammer
#Text=Drill
#Text=Hand saw or table saw
#Text=Utility scissors
#Text=Work gloves
#Text=Safety glasses
#Text=Steps
#Text=Creating an Upcycled Planter
#Text=Cut the 2L plastic bottle .
#Text=Make the cut about 1/4 of the way down , where the bottle flares out to the largest width .
#Text=Unscrew the bottle cap and drill a hole through it .
#Text=Place the plastic cap on a hard work surface and carefully drill a hole through the middle of the cap. Screw the cap back on the top of the bottle .
#Text=Ensure the hole is wide enough to fit your wick through .
#Text=Add water to the bottom of the bottle .
#Text=Fill it up about six inches up .
#Text=Take the top half of the bottle and insert into the bottom half , cap down .
#Text=Ensure a snug fit .
#Text=Make sure that the water in the bottom does n't overflow when the top is in place .
#Text=Cut 10-12 inches of the wick and thread it through the cap.
#Text=Ensure the wick is in the water and hold it at the top of the bottle .
#Text=Add soil to the top half of the bottle .
#Text=While holding the wick at the top , add in the soil .
#Text=The top half of the wick should now be buried in the soil .
#Text=Make sure that the soil is not overflowing at the top .
#Text=Make a small hole to plant your seeds .
#Text=After planting your seeds , water them and place planter somewhere where they can get enough sunlight .
#Text=Take care of your plant and watch it grow .
#Text=Creating a Wooden Pallet Planter
#Text=Break down your pallet .
#Text=Remove all the nails from the pallet and separate the panels from the blocks .
#Text=An easier way to do this is by cutting off the two shorter ends just inside of the blocks , then use a crowbar or hammer to remove the nails from the remaining wood .
#Text=Cut your wood panels to size .
#Text=Depending on how large you want your planter and how many pallets you have available , measure then cut your wood to size .
#Text=Create the foundation .
#Text=Cut two long pieces of wood , then nail shorter planks across forming the base .
#Text=You can leave a bit of space between the planks to allow for drainage .
#Text=Form the walls to your box .
#Text=Create a box around the base and in each corner nail in a support post .
#Text=The support posts will determine how tall your box will be .
#Text=Continue to build up the walls .
#Text=Build up the walls by nailing your side planks to support posts in each corner .
#Text=Sand away rough edges .
#Text=When you have built up the walls to your desired height , use sandpaper to sand down the rough edges surfaces .
#Text=Fill with soil .
#Text=After you have completed your box , fill with soil and transfer your mature plants .
#Text=Always water your plants after transfer .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Safety first .
#Text=Always wear eye protection when cutting or sawing wood .
#Text=Using household compost in your planters is a great way to give your plants nutrition and keep a green footprint .
